title: Software Development Engineer (Machine Learning)
text:
job application for software development engineer (machine learning) at a thinking ape





















          apply now
        
software development engineer (machine learning)

        at a thinking ape
      
(view all jobs)

        vancouver
      


the job
you will help us grow the application of machine learning systems within all of our games. this includes integrating machine learning into our games, improving existing models and identifying new areas it can be applied. 
 the team
you’ll be working on our data/growth team, also known as team narwhal (all our teams are named after sea creatures 🐠). you will join a group of talented engineers and data scientists just scraping the surface of how we can implement machine learning within our games. you will have the opportunity to shape this function within the organization and contribute directly to the growth of our games and player experience.
things you will work on:

collaborating with our team of talented engineers and data scientists to integrate machine learning features into our products
improving our existing machine learning models
identifying opportunities to apply machine learning to our products
prototyping and iterating machine learning algorithms for various problems
conducting online or offline tests to validate prototypes and solutions

 who you are:

you possess strong computer science fundamentals in algorithms and data structures
you have a solid understanding of statistical modelling and machine learning
you have experience applying machine learning libraries in previous projects
you have experience working with large scale code bases
you have sql and relational database skills
you are an excellent communicator in both written and oral forms

while all our apes are different, to thrive here you should: 

be self motivated, take pride in your work and enjoy huge amounts of ownership
set aside your ego and have wonderful arguments with your coworkers in order to create something better than any one person could individually
challenge your own assumptions and use data to make decisions whenever possible 
be passionate about teaching others what you know and continuing your own growth every day
not be afraid to fail, you experiment and learn from your mistakes

tell us if you:

have industry software engineering experience
have experience building end-to-end machine learning systems.
have experience working with big data (hadoop, mapreduce, bigquery, aws,  kafka, etc) 
hold a bsc., msc., or ph.d. in statistics, machine learning, computer science, computer engineering, software engineering or equivalent
have contributed to any open source projects

about ata 
a thinking ape is an independent mobile games startup with big ambitions. we are a team of 60 people, though sometimes we call ourselves apes 🦍 + 1-3 dogs 🐶  (depending on the day), growing in the heart of downtown vancouver. on wednesdays we all eat catered lunch together. so far taco bars are our favourite 🌮 , but we're open to new suggestions.
our years of success comes down to our belief in people: both our team and our players. we build games that foster communities and provide our players with tools to interact in deeply strategic and passionate ways, creating games that become a part of our player’s lives. but building games of this quality is challenging, so we work hard to find the smartest and most talented people in the world, then give them the freedom to do their best work.
we champion a culture of ownership, based on exploration and debate regardless of position. our team is supported with an open concept studio space, movable standing workstations and employee-determined work schedules. we keep communication flowing with quarterly state of the ape meetings, mid-quarter updates with our directors, monthly ask a founder fridays, and regular one-on-ones with your team lead.
looking for more information? check out our story to find out how we got to where we are today and learn about our culture by following #thisisata on social. listen to co-founder kenshi arasaki talk about what it’s like to work here.
we value passion and diversity and believe that our differences make us better as a collective. if you’re ready to make the next generation of top grossing mobile games, we’d love to hear from you!

						welcome. you are not signed in.|my account optionsmy job basket|sign inbmocareers.support@bmo.comthis service is set to disconnect automatically after {0} minutes of inactivity. your session will end in {1} minutes.click ok to reset the timer to {0} minutes.you have been signed out.this service is set to sign out after {0} minutes of inactivity.job searchmy job pagebasic search|jobs matching my profile|beginning of the main content section.return to the home pageprintable format  job description - senior manager, data scientist and machine learning specialist (1700009144)job description senior manager, data scientist and machine learning specialist-1700009144description the senior manager, data scientist and machine learning specialist, works with business and technology partners to lead the design, development, and implementation of statistical and machine learning-based solutions that drive measurable business outcomes and create a distinctive customer experience.  in this role, you will engage senior business partners to dissect business problems, conduct research and analysis, generate ideas, structure data and building end-to-end statistical and machine-learning solutions.
 
this is an exciting opportunity that is on the forefront of a critical enterprise capability and priority for the bank. as a change agent, you will be providing thought leadership to the enterprise on the value of data, analytics and machine learning and get to work with lines of business across the bank to help them achieve their objectives.
 
this role would be attractive for data scientists who have experience with big data analytics on large volumes and wide varieties of structured and unstructured data, and are looking to gain a wide exposure to problems in the financial industry.
 
what will you do?


engage business partners to advocate the benefit of machine learning, and work collaboratively to define machine learning solutions for priority business problems

lead partner interviews, brainstorming sessions and workshops to capture business objectives and prioritize opportunities


translate business objectives into high quality analytical and machine learning-based end-to-end solutions that are innovative and drive real business outcomes

lead in the design, development, and implementation of innovative machine learning and analytical solutions and build roadmaps for business transformation


design and build proofs of concept and real world statistical and machine learning solutions aligned to business priorities

generate a roadmap of opportunities with the businesses you work with and implement solutions iteratively to drive value

contribute to enterprise data and analytics strategy and champion adoption of enterprise analytics capabilities, including “big data” platforms and open source toolsqualifications what do you need to succeed?   knowledge   possesses a university degree in data science, computer science, engineering, physics, financial modeling and/or mathematics (masters or phd preferred) and/or 7 to 10 years of experience in advanced analytics with machine learning, finance and/or consulting  advanced machine learning applications of python or r, including relevant packages and statistical testing methodologies  experience with implementation of solutions with modern machine learning platforms within a hadoop environment, e.g. spark, tensorflow, and h2o  experience using a wide range of analytical techniques: supervised learning, clustering, natural language processing (nlp), recommender engines, time series analysis, a/b testing, network/link analysis, sentiment analysis and data visualization   skills   demonstrates solid communication skills (both written and verbal) and relationship management skills at a senior management level  exhibits advanced critical thinking skills, integrative skills and creativity to drive innovation   demonstrates ability to build a good fact base, apply sound reasoning, and generate relevant recommendations that get implemented and lead to business success  able to work highly independently and manage multiple priorities  possesses solid leadership skills and is able to work successfully with a team that has diverse skills, knowledge, and educational backgrounds   we’re here to help    at bmo we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the centre of everything we do – helping people is in our dna. for 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. we help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.    as a member of the bmo team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. we strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. we’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. from in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.    to find out more visit us at https://bmocareers.com.     bmo is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. by learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.   #li-mf1              job risk managementprimary location canada-ontario-torontoorganisation data governance & analytics-x004874schedule full-timejob posting 06/13/17unposting date ongoingplease note, if you are using internet explorer this site requires ie11 or greater.

text:

machine learning developer

machine learning developer
richmond, british columbia, canada

descriptiondescriptionnews360 employs state-of-the-art natural language processing and personalisation algorithms to build content personalization and analysis product for consumers and businesses, including the award-winning news360 mobile app, and the nativeai publisher analytics suite. we provide personalised news recommendations tracking millions of different interests, and build publisher analytics tools that drive content strategies reaching millions of readers every day.we are looking for a highly motivated machine learning developer who is passionate about solving hard problems with data, with strong software development skills or an extended academic background.main responsibilities: design, implement, and optimize machine learning models for event analytics, text processing, personalisation; analyze performance and event statistics data, present your findings to the team to help drive product decisions; write production-ready python code that is easy to support; work with other engineers to launch and deploy new services. requirements strong experience in classification, information retrieval, natural language processing, machine learning and related sub-fields. knowledge of machine learning theory and algorithms: svm, random forest, gradient boosting methods etc. experience in processing large amounts of potentially dirty data. proficiency with python and common machine learning libraries. good communication skills. creative and critical thinking capabilities and troubleshooting skills. work with minimal supervision, be proactive and self-motivated. education:bs or ms in computer science or related field (machine learning, data mining, natural language processing, information retrieval). phd is a big plus.good to have: proficiency in common machine learning/deep learning frameworks: sklearn, tensorflow, theano, torch, keras, etc. experience with common nlp tasks: language recognition, stemming & morphological segmentation/parsing, text categorization, clustering, text summarisation etc. knowledge of german, spanish, portuguese languages is a definite asset. french, italian, russian, japanese, chinese, korean are also beneficial; publications in related fields; experience with dask, apache spark, and similar software; benefits choose your own hardware when you join; great insurance package; 15+ paid vacation days; flexible hours — we track performance, not butts-in-seats.

title: Data Scientist
text:
tucows careers - data scientist



























 











                                                    tucows careers                                            






                data scientist
    
    

                            analytics & insights            
                    toronto,
                            ontario
                
                        



        apply
    



preamble:tucows is looking to add two data scientists to our analytics & insights team. together, we’re responsible for all of the reporting, analytics, data flows, visualization, machine learning and related business intelligence operations within the company.  success in this role requires four related components.  the first is that at your core, you are curious.  you live for going down the rabbit hole. chasing mysteries, finding quirks, and peeling back all the layers.  finding new questions to you is almost as fun as answering them, but answer them you do, with solid statistical proof displayed in clear language and compelling visualizations. the second requirement is an ability and interest in understanding our business.   we’ve got lots of data, but it’s not going to turn itself into information, and you can’t help with that unless you understand what the numbers mean.  learning about our business will be made both easy and fun by your deep and passionate love of the internet.  you believe it’s powerfully transformative and even, perhaps, the greatest thing ever.  you can’t wait to be a part of helping tucows make the internet even more awesome. the third component is that you really, for serious­, love math and coding. your arsenal of algorithms is both deep and broad.  you know precisely which tool is right for the job and you also know why.the last, but certainly not least, component is the ability and willingness to continuously learn about new technologies. the data science ecosystem is a fast-evolving beast. newer and more powerful tools are released all the time. you are a data scientist who is constantly updating their knowledge of data science state-of-the-art.if you have these four qualities, you’ll find tucows an exciting, ambitious and supportive environment in which to do impactful data science work.  main purpose of position:responsible for the provision of information to drive business decision making, via:ongoing collaboration with business specialists to understand drivers and needsanalysis of our unique data sets, including:sales and usage dataweb and social analyticsunstructured text  forecasting and time series data analyticsleveraging existing data sets to provide predictive informationongoing evaluation of available structured and unstructured data setsexperimentation with data to find useful insights application of machine learning (regression, clustering, classification, deep learning etc) processes and techniquesapplication of natural language processing techniques and toolskey position responsibilities/objectives:% of time | description of task / duty25% | responsible for cooperative ongoing dialogue on business requirements for information50% | responsible for self-directed research into available data sets and the various possibilities for extracting information relevant to the business, and for engagement of business functions in the evaluation of results15% | responsible for evolution of tools and techniques for the extraction and delivery of information and insights to internal and external customers10% | responsible for documentation of processes for converting data into information, and training/assistance for internal resources on how best to utilize the resulting reports etc.knowledge, skills & abilitiestop-notch communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skillsexcellent math and statistical analysis skills, especially as they pertain to business and experimentationdeep knowledge and experience of the algorithms and techniques of modern data sciencean interest and proficiency in the presentation and visualization of numbers and statistical dataability to understand business imperatives and drivers, find relevant data correlations, and create processes by which the data correlations are translated to information flows that help drive the business3-5 years of quantitative analysis experience, including handling, manipulating and analyzing data and creating analytical reportsknowledge and experience of semantic and sentiment analysis, machine learning and natural language processingcomfortable writing complex sql queries to extract and integrate data from multiple database sourcescomfortable using programming languages such as python and/or r to work with data setsexcellent knowledge of microsoft excel and google docsability to document work and effectively prioritize documentationability to work on multiple projects in parallel while managing constantly changing deadlines and prioritiesnice to haves:experience with hadoop, spark and similar data storage and processing toolsexperience with deep learning methodologiesm.s. or phd, preferably in a statistical, mathematical, or technical field

tucows is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment and is an equal opportunity employer. if you have any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process, please notify us so we can provide suitable accommodation.

reference number: tbd17j-014677-003246selection process number: 2017-tbd-ea-ba-102962-01



	treasury board of canada secretariat
	
 	- expenditure management sector
	

























ottawa (ontario)














ec-03, ec-04





	
	




  indeterminate and determinate





	
	ec-03 salary: $63,428 to $71,769 and ec-04 salary: $68,468 to $79,234



	for further information on the organization, please visit treasury board of canada secretariat
closing date:


	
	10 october 2017 - 23:59, pacific time
	

who can apply:




 
 
persons residing in canada and canadian citizens residing abroad. 
 
 





















apply online


important messages
note that this advertisement was originally posted as selection process number: 2017-tbd-ea-ba-102962.only applications received directly via the system (https://www.canada.ca/en/public-service-commission/jobs/services/public-service-jobs.html) will be accepted. if you require accommodation for any reason, you must contact the hr advisor listed below before the closing date. if you do not clearly demonstrate how you meet all screening criteria, your application will be rejected. your application may also be rejected if it has incomplete information. we will not contact you to request information that is missing from your application
work environmentare you a data-driven problem solver with a solid foundation in math or computer science? are you intellectually curious, self-motivated, and possess strong business acumen? the treasury board of canada secretariat is looking for motivated data scientists to join a multidisciplinary team dedicated to improving transparency and openness in government reporting through the tbs infobase—a searchable online database providing financial and human resources information on government of canada operations.the successful candidate will, among other things, work to create data visualizations and new data systems, integrate existing data systems to create intelligence, use new technologies to extract more value from existing data and automate analysis which is currently done manually.the treasury board of canada secretariat (tbs) is a central agency located in the national capital region. working at tbs offers a unique opportunity to contribute to the work of a central federal agency, and to be part of cultivating the federal public service as a model workplace. with high-performing teams and innovative practices, tbs professionals in various fields serve canadians by collaborating on government-wide initiatives, driving excellence in people management and taking initiative while effectively managing risks.if you are a leader, a motivator and a strategic thinker who wants to work for one of canada’s top employers, consider joining the tbs team.
intent of the process

		anticipatory process - a pool of qualified persons resulting from this process will be created and may be used to fill similar positions with linguistic profiles (english essential, french essential, bilingual imperative bbb/bbb, bilingual imperative cbc/cbc, bilingual non-imperative bbb/bbb, bilingual non-imperative cbc/cbc) as well as tenures (indeterminate, deployment, acting, assignment, secondment, specified period) which may vary according to the position being staffed.this pool will be used to staff similar positions in other organizations within the core public administration (http://www.psc-cfp.gc.ca/plcy-pltq/rfli-lirf/index-eng.htm).by applying to this process, you consent to your personal application-related information being shared with other government departments interested in staffing similar positions.



positions to be filled:





number to be determined







information you must provide

  
  
    your résumé.
  

  
  

  
  

  
  
  
  

  
  

  
  

  you must meet all essential qualifications in order to be appointed to the position. other qualifications may be a deciding factor in choosing the person to be appointed. some essential and other qualifications will be assessed through your application. it is your responsibility to provide appropriate examples that illustrate how you meet each qualification. failing to do so could result in your application being rejected.

in order to be considered, your application must clearly explain how you meet the following (essential qualifications)education:graduation with a degree from a recognized post-secondary institution with acceptable specialization in economics, sociology or statistics.candidates must always have a degree. the courses* for the specialization must be acceptable and may have been taken at a recognized post-secondary institution, but not necessarily within a degree program in the required specialization. the specialization may also be obtained through an acceptable combination of education, training and/or experience.*note that the course requirement can be attained in programs such as: mathematics, computer science, data science/data analytics, accounting, demography/population studies, environmental sciences, epidemiology, geology, and/or finance.degree equivalencyexperience common to both streams:-experience in large scale* data management, validation, cleaning and categorizing as well as database development, data mining and data analysis, including recent** experience with tools such as python, r, sas, or sql.*large scale is based on data records numbering in the thousands or above.**recent is defined as experience normally acquired within the last three (3) years.the following will be applied / assessed at a later date (essential for the job)various language requirements-bilingual imperative bbb/bbb and cbc/cbc;-bilingual non-imperative bbb/bbb and cbc/cbc;-english essential;-french essential.information on language requirementsec-03 stream:experience in any one (1) of the following: -recent** experience using programming languages (such as python, r, javascript, ruby or sas) to develop data visualizations;-experience undertaking research and analysis to produce reports summarizing empirical findings;-experience in using machine learning methodologies to solve problems.ec-04 stream:-recent** experience in using programming languages (python, r, javascript, ruby, or sas) to develop data visualizations;-experience in undertaking research and analysis to produce reports summarizing empirical findings;-experience in using machine learning methodologies to solve problems. **recent is defined as experience normally acquired within the last three (3) years.knowledge:-knowledge of programming languages (such as python, r, javascript, ruby, sas, or sql) and techniques used to analyze and present complex data to non-technical audiences.abilities:-ability to analyze and present complex data to non-technical audiences using programming languages and related techniques;-ability to build and maintain professional relationships;-ability to communicate effectively in writing;-ability to communicate effectively orally.personal suitability:-creative thinking;-reliability; -flexibility;-initiative.the following may be applied / assessed at a later date (may be needed for the job)asset qualificationseducation:one or more of the following:(1) a graduate or post-graduate degree from a recognized post-secondary institution in economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial mathematics, data science, computer science, applied finance, or engineering.(2) university-level courses in any of the following: -data mining;-data warehousing;-business intelligence and data visualizations; -data analytics;-geo-spatial analysis. (3) certifications relevant to the field including:-chartered public accountant (cpa);-chartered financial analyst (cfa);-certified analytics professional (cap);-cloudera certified professional: data scientist (ccp:ds);-emc: data science associate (emcdsa).degree equivalencyexperience:-recent* experience working with the wet (web experience toolkit) and wcag 2.0 guidelines for accessibility;-experience in policy development or program delivery in an area that spans the government of canada’s responsibilities (e.g. infrastructure, it infrastructure, procurement, indigenous peoples, veterans, students, etc.);-experience working with government of canada expenditure management or people management data;-experience working with unstructured data such as text, social media, video feeds or audio;-recent* experience working in a collaborative developer/information technology (it) professional environment to automate the process of software delivery and infrastructure changes (for example dev ops);-experience working with big data including use of technologies such as distributed calculation, distributed databases, and hadoop;-experience in developing and supporting the implementation of business rules, standards, policies, guidelines or processes related to one or more of the following: data access, creation, production, storage, dissemination or evaluation of data/metadata;-working with and structuring large scale** geo-coded data for analysis and presentation;-experience working with any of the following: spss, java, perl, c/c++, hadoop, d3, shiny, tableau, and/or powerbi.*recent is defined as experience normally acquired within the last three (3) years.**large scale is based on data records numbering in the thousands or above.organizational needs:-treasury board secretariat employees affected by workforce adjustment may be appointed before persons employed by other government organizations.-in support of achieving a diverse workforce, consideration may be given to candidates self-identifying as belonging to one of the following employment equity groups: aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and women.operational requirements: -willingness to work overtime on short notice;-willingness to travel occasionally.conditions of employmentvarious security levels: -reliability status security clearance;-secret security clearance.
other information
we will communicate with you about this process by email. as a result, you must update your public service resourcing system profile if it changes. applicants should use an email address that accepts messages from unknown senders (some email systems block such messages).if you do not respond to our communications, we will interpret this as your withdrawal from the process.candidates may be required to meet the asset qualifications or the organizational needs, depending on the requirements of the specific position being staffed.reference checks will be sought.an interview will be administered.a test will be administered.please identify clearly for which position(s) you are submitting an application.you must provide proof of your education credentials.persons are entitled to participate in the appointment process in the official language of their choice.you must indicate on your application if you require a technical aid for testing or an alternative method of assessment.
the public service of canada is committed to building a skilled, diverse workforce reflective of canadian society. as a result, it promotes employment equity and encourages candidates to indicate voluntarily on their application if they are a woman, an aboriginal person, a person with a disability or a member of a visible minority group.
the public service of canada is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. if contacted in relation to a job opportunity or testing, you should advise the public service commission or the departmental official in a timely fashion of the accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.
preference
preference will be given to veterans and to canadian citizens, in that order.
information on the preference to veterans
we thank all those who apply. only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
contact information


ruth anne holland - hr advisor



ruthanne.holland@tbs-sct.gc.ca

title: Data Scientist
text:
407 etr | career



skip to content






























search





































career opportunities







data scientist


location:
headquarters


job code:
504


# of openings:
2



description
position summary:
the successful candidate will assist in leveraging customer, digital and transportation datasets to create insights on pricing, marketing and customer behavior. the data scientist will assist the director of data analytics and other key stakeholders to bring actionable data driven solutions to 407etr. this job involves model design, data management, data queries, and providing input into programs and policies. this position is part of a highly collaborative and energetic team in a start-up minded environment.
position responsibility:

assemble and analyze data to understand customer behavior from existing 407 etr data, external data sources and emerging sources.


undertake analysis of target customer groups (segments) for specific marketing and pricing programs and assess opportunities and strategies for marketing.
ad hoc analysis and modeling of data.
ability to understand business stakeholder’s issues and create valuable insight.
raise awareness and action of data science within the company to help focus on fact based decisions.
support the department along with the information technology management department in planning the structure and storage of new customer related data fields.
represent the department in committees within the organization.

qualifications:

a university degree in engineering, statistics, mathematics, or computer science.


minimum 5 years working experience with data science techniques: clustering, regression models, classification, anomaly detection and other machine learning techniques.
minimum 5 years of experience with data analysis tools (eg. sas, r or python) and bi visualization for reporting.
well-developed business analysis, research and creative problem solving skills.
organizational skills and time management skills; planning and project management, and ability to meet multiple deadlines.
strong communication skills and work ethic.
highly collaborative team player with an entrepreneurial spirit.
familiarity with microstrategy is an asset.

note: this job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.
accommodations for disabilities or other grounds protected by human rights legislation are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the employment selection process.

$100,000 a year we are looking driven and entrepreneurial individuals with a strong background in data science and machine learning to help with the innovation and implementation of our workflow in different projects, for the purpose of investing, acquiring projects and royalties, and delineating targets for staking or drilling.goldspot discoveries is a technology and analytics company that is developing and refining machine-learning technology capable of significantly improving mineral exploration targeting on both a regional and local scale. the workflow and algorithm has proven to mitigate investment risk and increase the efficiency and success rate of exploration in data-rich environments.managed by seasoned industry experts from both financial and technical backgrounds, goldspot discoveries is aiming to completely change the investment decision model by using the goldspot algorithm to stake acreage, acquire projects and royalties, and invest in public vehicles to ultimately create a portfolio of assets with the greatest reward to risk ratio.already, the company has staked highly prospective targets in the abitibi region and is working with several current openings:
customer success manager

life at plum
at plum, we are transforming the hiring process. plum’s saas platform quantifies attitude and company culture to increase engagement, optimize teams and predict successful new hires. plum believes in the importance of building teams that are focused on creating a positive culture and being the right fit for the role.
we are funded with enterprise clients including: citrix, rocketspace, agoda, andela, allianzx and nestle. located in kitchener/waterloo, plum life is centered around loving what you do. each day our team comes to work excited to collaborate and create while having fun doing it. we are looking for people to build on to our strong foundation that will take our company to the next level.
what can you expect working at plum?

supportive workplace culture
competitive benefits
flex time
internal growth opportunity
various company outings

still not convinced? check out our social channels for some more insight into the plum life.














customer success manager
the customer success manager will be in charge of onboarding new clients and making sure that they're getting the most out of their plum experience.
the goals of plum's customer success manager are:

onboarding customers
tracking usage and helping develop new processes to increase efficiency
reducing customer churn (renewals)
growing upsells
growing referrals
helping collect case studies and testimonials
disseminating customer feedback into the organization (voice of the customer), particularly about our product
dedicatedly working with our customers toward their desired outcomes

required:
eager to learn all things "plum"
apply now








conversion rate optimization analyst
note: this is a full time 16-week contract placement that is funded by a grant.
we are looking for a data driven individual who is passionate about performance marketing to join our growing marketing team. this person most likely has a business and marketing background. you will be responsible for driving new buyer growth through improving plum’s website conversion rates. in this role you’ll report to the director of marketing to help increase client acquisition.
the goals of plum's conversion rate optimization analyst are:

analyze current conversion rates
design and execute various experiments to improve conversion rates on key landing and conversion pages
interpret test results to develop an audience/cohort based website content/offer roadmap and optimize marketing targeting and spend
conduct research and advise team on conversion developments and opportunities
manage website analytics tools
speak up when it comes to improving user experience and website conversion

required:
currently enrolled in a post-secondary program or has graduated within the last 12 months from a post-secondary program. field of study stem or business. canadian citizen, permanent resident or refugee status.
apply now








machine learning engineer
you will have the opportunity to use plum's unique data set to help shape the future of work. you won't be working alone — you will be collaborating with the engineering, marketing, product, and business development teams to marry our established expertise in io psychology with machine learning to enable the evolution of our products.
required:

3+ years of engineering experience building machine learning or ai systems
strong analytical and problem-solving skills
solid engineering and coding skills (preferably in python, c++)
deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinning, such as classification, recommendation systems and natural language processing
good understanding of common families of models, feature engineering, feature selection, and other practical machine learning issues such as overfitting
a ph.d or m.sc. in machine learning or a quantitative field leveraging ml techniques

apply now








about plum
we are an award-winning (gold stevie international business award 2015, cix top-20, 43north winner, buffalo 43north) company, agile, have raving fans, customers, recurring revenue, a massive market, funding, coverage in wired and the atlantic, widespread support across the united states, canada, throughout africa and many other emerging markets. plum is on track to be a household name in a few short years, and finally, is extremely humble (cough). :)
for companies with too many applicants, plum not only helps match for job fit and company culture, it is also the only tool on the market that identifies high potential applicants before anyone picks up a resume. come help us bring real change to the traditional hiring process!

title: Software Engineer/Machine Learning Hacker
text:
software engineer/machine learning hacker at software securedsoftware engineer/machine learning hackerottawa, onfull-timeapply to position apply using linkedinsoftware secured is an application security startup located in ottawa, ontario. we help software development teams to get ahead of hackers by leveraging our deep security knowledge.
software secured is looking for a self-motivated software engineer/machine learning hacker to help us build our next generation security product. if you are an experienced software engineer with an interest in crunching data, this position is for you. the ideal candidate will be a well seasoned software engineer, have an entrepreneurial spirit with a deep interest/understanding of exploring advances in machine learning. the individual will be motivated and passionate about data science trends and be a part of the local machine learning community. he/she will also have an affinity for security and vulnerability exploits.


do you understand the mechanics of how source code can be decomposed?


do you spend half of your time reading computer science papers and the other half reading advances in data science and machine learning?


do you care about, not only, an algorithm's effectiveness but also its computational efficiency?


if you said yes to most of these, we want you!
 
what you get:


competitive salary


company lunches


live hacking sessions


exposure to software development, application security, and machine learning


startup culture with an ability to directly affect the success of the company


 
mandatory:


strong programming and compiler background including c/c++, python, java, and flavors of ecmascript.


implemented and/or have a deep understanding of machine learning techniques, spectral clustering, svm and kernel development.


hold or in the process of holding a masters degree, or above, in computer science or engineering with a focus on machine learning.


nice to haves:


dabbled with scala


application security background including ctf related competitions


open source contributions


static code analysis


vulnerability scanning


 
what we care about
keeping it secure: software secured’s mission and values are a part of everything we do. we care about how our clients can do what they do without having to worry about hackers disrupting their work.
curiosity and humility: we are dedicated to learning and constantly improving. we hire the best of the best, humility is key to remain the best.
own it: our engineers work hard to improve the state of web application security. to get there, we need to own every project, every assessment, every challenge and every line of code.
dive deep: hard problems require diving deep to understand the real cause of the problem, we are not afraid at diving deep to come up with the best solutions.
bold: we take huge risks so our clients can minimize theirs, taking risks is part of what we do daily so we ensure the highest impact of our solutions.

about us: plantiga is a human analytics company that leverages the fusion of wearable hardware, cloud computing and machine learning to provide real-time predictive analytics for performance, health and safety. the company has developed a novel flexible footwear sensor that produces lab grade gait analytics in a mobile environment. combined with an advanced software back-end, the tiga system is a new type of motion capture. we aim to be the world leader in foot/ground interaction data, and are pioneering “human movement intelligence”. we are looking for a machine learning engineer to join us in changing the world of motion capture and movement analytics. responsibilities: develop dsp (digital signal processing) systems that help us structure and understand imu information  design and build customized, large-scale, cloud-based machine learning systems  validate and improve the accuracy of plantiga’s algorithms and analytics.  develop novel algorithms that provide value to customers. requirements: -- we don't expect them all but here's a good list of what we would love to see -- technical skills:  industry or academic experience working on a range of ml problems, particularly related to time series sensor data (imu, car sensor, medical device, etc).  expert software development skills with a focus for building sound and scalable ml.  excitement about taking cutting-edge technologies and techniques to one of the most important and most archaic industries.  a passion for finding, analyzing, and incorporating the latest research directly into the production environment.  good intuition for understanding what good research looks like, and where we should focus effort to maximize outcomes must have's:  understanding of deep learning frameworks like tensorflow or theano  working knowledge of digital signal processing. bonus:  experience with motion capture and/or computer vision systems. perks: our office is located in historic railtown, at 611 alexander. it boasts 18" ceilings and brick and beam architecture.  we are a fun group that puts collaboration, good energy and fun above most things. we do beer fridays where friends, family and colleagues can down for a beverage (or two). ‹ › return to plantiga technologies inc. apply for this job apply for this job apply for this job share not the right job? join our talent network return title: Data Scientist - Scala/Python
text: data scientist - scala/python - careers skip to content kronos© canada (fr-ca) united states (en-us) search jobs login search jobs /  job detail careers transcend the day-to-day work experience. work inspired. data scientist - scala/python location: montreal - quebec - canada function: engineering ref #: 201701098 apply > corporate overview you’re empowered when you’re a kronite want to be part of an elite group of highly skilled professionals? we think our employees are a special group of talented, energetic, and innovative people. and for that reason, we refer to ourselves as kronites. kronites care about more than just work. we recognize the need to maintain a healthy work-life balance — to live inspired. in fact, it’s expected! whether you’re playing foosball in one of our game rooms, working up a healthy sweat in group fitness classes, or videoconferencing with kronites thousands of miles away, you’ll soon learn that we take work and fun seriously. no matter what position you hold at kronos, you’re a kronite. and we want you to feel like you have the power to make a difference in your life and the lives of others, at work and beyond.   kronos is the global leader in workforce management solutions that enable organizations to control labor costs, minimize compliance risk, and improve workforce productivity. tens of thousands of organizations in 100 countries – including more than half the fortune 1000® - use kronos time and attendance, scheduling, absence management, hr and payroll, hiring, and labor analytics applications.  kronos customers include enterprises large and small across diverse industries worldwide including retail, hospitality, healthcare, manufacturing, public sector, services, and distribution.   kronos is a privately held company and was founded in 1977. headquartered in chelmsford, massachusetts, kronos employs more than 5,000 people worldwide.   kronos is an equal opportunity employer. description our advantages at a glance! 1) unlimited vacation: we follow the practices of the best it companies in the world 2) work from home: 1 to 2 days a week (you must be in the greater montreal region however) 3) annual bonus: 7% 4) contribution up to $ 3000 / year to group rrsp 5) payment of tuition fees up to $ 5250 / year / employee, possibility of scholarship for employees' children 6) a unique playground: a very wide variety of data from very large global companies (transactional data, schedule, overtime...) 7) we respect you need to rest on week-ends ! at kronos, unlike other world leaders who recruit data scientists, you will never be asked to come to work on sundays! 8) your direct impact at the highest level. you report directly to the kronos data science director, tom walsh based in massachusetts who coaches and supervises 4 data scientists, including 1 senior who works in montreal. tom speaks daily with the senior management of kronos and your team is highly recognized and appreciated. responsibilities: • work with domain experts, perform data studies and analysis with workforce management data to identify meaningful business opportunities. • apply machine learning and ai algorithms to analyze the data and generate models that can be applied to the workforce management domain. • rapidly prototype data science and ai solutions for integration with workforce management products and services. • implement data science methodologies at scale over large datasets. • interface with product team to develop requirements and analyze the tests/data resulting from machine learning activities. • identify and analyze additional data sources to augment the production opportunities. • communicate insights and findings to internal and external stakeholders • enjoy working and learning in a fast paced and rapidly evolving environment qualifications required qualifications: • ms or phd (phd preferred) in computer science/machine learning, statistics, data science or a quantitative field • 3+ years' experience as a data scientist, though exceptional junior candidates will also be considered. • substantial depth in at least 1-2 machine learning subfields, including but not limited to regression, classification, time-series analysis, clustering, etc. • hands-on experience applying machine learning or data science techniques to real-world data • practical ability to visualize data, communicate meaningful business insights, and utilize them effectively. • ability to rapidly develop prototypes in various programming languages, such as scala, python, java, and r. • must be an effective communicator, making complex concepts accessible to all stakeholders. • must have a high level of initiative and sound independent judgment. preferred qualifications: • hands-on experience applying big data / map reduce techniques, including spark and hadoop distributed-computing platforms, to real-world problems. • experience applying ai (including but not limited to automated planning, nlp, multi-agent systems, etc.) or operations research techniques. • familiarity and comfort with sql and relational databases. • knowledge of nosql database technologies. • french oral understanding a plus. eeo statement kronos is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive work environment. all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, or veteran title: Junior Data Scientist
text:
junior data scientist - adlib software - job board go to our website » « go back to job listings junior data scientist location: burlington, ontario, canada department: r&d type: full time min. experience: entry level at adlib, we are redefining the future of content management. we've displaced gorillas in the market with a focus on customer service and success. we are adding to our suite of offerings, building a new product with a unique approach to data insights. like most tech companies, adlib started small, in response to a problem our co-founders experienced as business leaders. they recognized a need for rapidly generated solutions to leverage the value in unstructured data. but unlike most tech companies, those original co-founders continue to be directly involved in the daily operations of the company as ceo, vp r&d and vp customer success. they've built adlib on three pillars of strength that measure our success: product innovation. we build up from our roots, improvising - adlibbing - solutions to client document and data management problems. customer relationships. we have a dedicated focus on creating a positive customer experience that stands out from everyone else. truly engaged and passionate team. that's where you come in. who you are you are obsessed with solving big data problems and determining value of dark data. you want to be fully immersed in an r&d role where you can push the boundaries of knowledge and innovate new solutions to be patented. you are looking for a role where you can leverage your knowledge and our technologies to give meaning and make decisions around unstructured data. you want to use research, natural language processing, machine learning and artificial intelligence to solve data science challenges. you want an opportunity to drive forward the creation of algorithms that will become part of the adlib elevate platform and have a significant impact on thousands of organizations across the globe. there are very few roles like this one out there. our new jr. data scientist will work with: big data. collect, ingest, store and analyze large datasets from structured and unstructured data. transform and convert unstructured dataset into structured data products. best practices. identify and evaluate standardized methods, best practices, models and algorithms to solve the problems. machine learning. research and develop new machine learning techniques and algorithms to address needs. train and build machine learning models to meet goals. experiments. test and validate the solutions. apply the latest technologies in modeling and data mining to the the experiments insights. use data mining techniques and build statistical models to classify and perform data extraction from content. knowledge sharing. document methods and algorithms used in solutions. you will: collaborate. work closely with engineering colleagues to design, build and test new and improved solutions. our new jr. data scientist has: phd in computer science or related field such as mathematics or statistics proven track record of delivering high quality analytics insights and solutions on unstructured data practical expertise using: clustering, regression and classification machine learning techniques data visualization tools distributed big data stores (e.g. hadoop or others) working with tb+ scale datasets statistical modeling, data mining, pattern recognition and search ranking experience designing machine learning pipeline expert knowledge of algorithms and data structures   strong programming skills: python, java, .net or equivalent experience designing, conducting, analyzing and interpreting experiments outstanding critical thinking, creativity, communication and problem solving skills why join adlib? our employees, new and not-so-new, tell us we excel at transparency and work-life balance. and while those may be buzzwords used to attract attention, we actually live them. how do we know this? a significant portion of our team has been here for longer than 10 years. in the tech industry, that's rare. we have people who leave and come back because they miss the culture and our team spirit. but, having said that, we aren't perfect at everything. we're continuously working on change management - we've lost count of how many whiteboards we have. we don't have all of the processes we'd like to, but that means that this is the place to get your hands dirty, come up with your own processes and work without a net. while this might be common in silicon valley, in the suburbs of toronto, it's rare and greatly appreciated to have an open-vacation policy and to promote employee wellness. we have massage therapist days, badminton, baseball, fresh fruit in the lunchroom and fitness membership reimbursement. our burlington, ontario location translates to minimal commute time and maximum family time and productivity time. if you aren't stuck in traffic, worried about being late for a professional or personal commitment, life is just less stressful and work is more enjoyable. adlib software is revolutionizing the way organizations think about their content, join us to be part of that change. apply now or follow us on twitter, facebook or linkedin. adlib seeks to inspire and nurture the human spirit - we understand that each person brings a distinct life experience to the table. embracing diversity not only enhances our work culture but drives business success. adlib encourages applications from everybody, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. forward this position recipient email address (one) your name your email address enter a message (optional) privacy & terms

website
ruby 


ruby a global technology company that is home to the world’s most unique dating web sites. like relationships, ruby is complex and multifaceted. ashley madison , the flagship brand of ruby , is revolutionizing the way millions of people located around the world connect and meet. as a canadian technology company driven by analytics and user centric design, we care about our customer experience and are continuously looking for ways to make it better!
life is short, be agile and step out of the box. does the idea of working creatively every day with the ability to dig deeper and solve huge problems intrigue you? do you envision yourself working with smart people in a collaborative, fast-paced, environment using the latest technology tools? have you always dreamed about working for a company where you can apply your great talents and continue to learn and grow throughout your career? if you answered “yes” to all of these questions then ruby is the place for you!
we work hard, play hard and have fun. we foster a culture where you can be yourself and where diversity workforce, thought, and opinion is expected.
data developer
as a data developer, some of your duties will include designing a/b test experiments and analyzing their outcomes, data mining user behavioural data, analyzing marketing campaign effectiveness, and making recommendations to improve user site experience.
here’s the team you will be joining
be a data developer, be a rock star of the company!
you will join a dynamic analytics team of data loving, number crunching individuals who drive the business forward. your insights will support all levels of our business by making data driven decisions.
are you passionate about finding insights from numbers? with millions of members worldwide, you will never get bored or worry about sample size when you design a multivariate data experiment. as a team, we consistently do pretty awesome big data work.
we are a leading edge company, and so is our analytics team. we’ve built up a list of cool business intelligence tools and created fancy data visualization dashboards. we explore new technologies in order to keep ourselves at the forefront of the industry.
here’s what you’ll do

work independently from requirements gathering through to shipping code to start off our internal tools and analytics development projects
work with the data scientist team to build out additional tools to support their work, derive new models and analyses, and help take their analysis to the next level (with over 50 million members worldwide, the data base is significant)
continuously identify ways to measure our business and use technology to enhance everything we do
ensure assigned services & written code are maintained to ensure optimum performance (along with writing new tools)
empower the analyst team by augmenting their statistical abilities with software tools to allow for either faster or more complex analysis
build and maintain a suite of user facing data tools and bi applications
ability to “do everything” from system administration, to development, to qa in order to deliver any software product
understand statistical methods and tools to integrate into your software solutions
research the latest information on machine learning and statistics software development and communicate/inform other stakeholders of “what is possible”
other duties as assigned

here’s what you’ll need
experience requirements:

2+ years in full stack software development, demonstrated experience writing web applications
hands-on working knowledge with lamp. we run/host our internal tools on linux, python, apache, mysql, and php.
experience working with mvc frameworks (cakephp, symfony/silex experience is a plus)
expert knowledge with relational database, writing & creating highly optimized queries
strong analytical and quantitative skills—you will work with data scientists.
knowledge with machine learning and distributed big data tools (spark, kafka, hdfs, and cassandra) is a plus
ability to work independently and within a cross functional team environment.

academic requirements:

bsc computer science, engineering or math or, equivalent academic & related work experience.
new graduates welcome

here’s what we provide:

an aggressive compensation package
we are conveniently located just steps from the ttc subway
the opportunity to work with brilliant people in an entrepreneurial, forward thinking environment
friday mixer every week
company-provided lunch every 2 weeks and breakfast every friday
incredible social events

qualified candidates should send a resume and cover letter to human resources. in the e-mail subject line please reference “data developer.“
we thank all applicants for their interest ruby; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
ruby is an equal opportunity employer. we encourage applications from all qualified candidates, including members of designated groups. ruby will provide reasonable workplace accommodation to applicants with disabilities.

title: 
                        
senior manager, data science & model innovation
                        









 

requisition id: 7949
join the global community of scotiabankers to help customers become better off.
purpose:
the senior manager data science & model innovation contributes to bank targets by bringing data science and machine learning experience and expertise to evolve and innovate the current data science practices as applied to risk models.

the incumbent will be joining a small, highly strategic team tasked with bringing innovation around the mathematical techniques, tools, platforms and technology and datasets currently being utilized for risk modelling. advancements in these areas will transform the bank’s approach for addressing business challenges. the senior manager will also evaluate/recommend changes to the bank’s data, model development and model deployment infrastructure in order to transform the bank’s speed to market capabilities.

key accountabilities:
work with large scale and complex traditional and non-traditional data sources to identify opportunities that enhance credit risk model performance. the senior manager will explore and examine data from multiple sources to discover hidden insights within the data and to evaluate alternate methods for using this data in an agile fashion. these models are used to originate new loans, manage existing customer risk, manage collection treatment and forecast loan loss provisions.
evaluate advancements in statistical analysis and model development methodologies and software. work with internal and external partners on big data & advanced analytics initiatives. the senior manager will review advancements in the industry and identify ways this learning could be used to transform current methodologies, tools and processes. he/she will use this knowledge to deploy innovative ideas that challenge existing assumptions and processes.
ensure the data used for model development is reliable and robust and that it adheres to bank and industry standards. the preparation and management of complex data is essential for ensuring model integrity. strong understanding of business related characteristics, as well as proper handling of data anomalies and missing values are critical success factors.
identify and recommend improvements that streamline, automate, and standardize data processes. research best practices and propose innovations designed to enhance risk management’s ability to increase profitability and enhance customer experience. build frameworks to test data used for risk models simultaneously.
provide consultative support to management, within and outside of risk management on initiatives pertaining to source data strengths/weaknesses.
liaise with partners both internally as well as external vendors and data providers to review proposals and submit recommendations for acquiring new data sources.

functional competencies:
this position is extremely complex and highly technical.  the incumbent works with staff having diverse statistical and technological education/experience and recommends innovations while maintaining focus on departmental goals.  he/she must keep pace with changes in the predictive scoring, big data and technology areas.  the incumbent requires the following qualifications:
3+ years of experience working for a major institution in the role of a data scientist or equivalent practical experience.
knowledge of building complex mathematical models (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) with a deep understanding of data interactions combined with practical application.
machine learning and/or sophisticated data mining experience 
apache spark, hadoop project, r, python, julia, scala, sas etc…
data structure and extraction techniques.  
the incumbent must be efficient and flexible as work is normally conducted under tight deadlines and with conflicting/multiple priorities.  excellent project management, problem solving, analytical and decision-making skills.
well-developed communication skills are required as internal and external presentations are frequent (e.g. at lenders/managers meetings, partners etc.).  excellent written communication skills are also essential for preparing proposals, management reports, and responding to field queries.

educational requirements:
ms or phd in a quantitative field (computer science, physics, mathematics, statistics, bio-informatics etc)
 
location(s):  canada : ontario : toronto
as canada’s international bank, we are a leader when it comes to inclusion. we are a diverse and global team, speaking more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. candidates selected for an interview will be contacted directly.  if you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. we will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.









job segment: 
database, bank, banking, developer, risk management, technology, finance

job postings: sunnybrook research institute apply for position research software developer  posted: 06/27/2017 9:14:03 am   research software developer a full-time position is available in the image processing laboratory, physical sciences platform, sunnybrook research institute, toronto. this is a one year grant funded position with the possibility for renewal. the successful applicant will join the martel research group which is focused on the development of image analysis and machine learning techniques applied to medical imaging and to digital histology. their primary role will be to support research work on automatic detection, segmentation and characterization of tumours in breast and brain mri. responsibilities: integrate existing algorithms into robust, production-quality software design data analysis pipelines for importing and processing medical image data using existing tools assist in the development of new image analysis methods refine and test software to meet user requirements. provide documentation and training on software requirements: a strong background in image analysis at minimum a bachelor’s degree, preferably an msc or phd degree in a relevant discipline 2-3 years programming experience with c++ experience with complete software development life cycle experience delivering production-quality software experience with itk and dcmtk previous experience with medical imaging software development and dicom proficiency in python (preferred) and/or matlab excellent problem solving skills excellent communication skills ability to work well in a team and to use initiative in achieving your goals additionally the following experience would be an asset: experience with machine learning familiarity with linux command line/shell scripts familiarity with pacs and opencv in accordance with canadian employment and immigration guidelines, applicants must be eligible to work in canada. deadline for application: until the position is filled qualified candidates are invited to email their cover letter, cv and the names of three potential references to: kimberly.allen@sunnybrook.ca your interest in this opportunity is appreciated; however, only applicants invited for interview will be contacted. sunnybrook research institute is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act (aoda). if you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your cover letter. sunnybrook research institute is strongly committed to inclusion and diversity within its community and welcomes all applicants including but not limited to: visible minorities, all religions and ethnicities, persons with disabilities, lgbtq persons, and all others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas. « back to sunnybrook research institute   privacy policy terms of use site map careers title: Software Developer - Remote
text:
software developer - remote - rebel - job board view our website view all jobs at rebel we believe that those who contribute make us better. it’s why we create simple, useful tools to empower participation in the world’s bravest communication space: the internet.              we are experts in domain names and the products that make the most of them.work with us, and help people showcase their ideas, stories, services and contributions to the world.  our manifesto: be thoughtful, be simple, be brave. software developer - remote toronto, on, canada full time rebel experienced rebels are visionaries, trail blazers, risk takers, and fearless in their endeavours. rebels dream big with big resolve.  rebel is both our name and our identity. it defines us. it shapes the work we do, guides the products we build and enhances the experiences we share.  position we are looking for an experienced application developer to work within a small nimble development team.  you will be collaborating with our ceo on experimental product development projects where you will contribute to design and development while taking a minimum viable product to market. the subject matter will vary, but your common thread will be experimenting with modern approaches to server software and cloud computing. in this position, you will contribute to both development and operations of a small and existing cloud application, and will code on fast-paced, high energy, and exploratory product development team. for this position, we require a computer science or related degree and 5+ years of development experience. you will have experience: managing multiple development projects to achieve real world objectives designing and coding fast, secure, and scalable applications leveraging cloud computing services and approaches (aws/google cloud) architecting object oriented and soa systems (java, nodejs, perl, php, or c#) developing relational databases (mysql, mssql) integrating with partners, customers, and third-party systems via web api/websockets web application development skills not required, but are a plus. (js, html5) you know or are willing to quickly learn: agile & scrum project management techniques minimum viable product development analytical skills for performance measurement and data driven decisions how to leverage advanced cloud platform services and techniques managing linux based servers and applications development project hygiene: source control, automated build and continuous integration maintainable & testable code progressive release our approach we strive for simple, clean and testable code we love cloud computing (aws) and service architecture you support your team and raise everyone’s game you support what you build you are brave and take action you will be working on: contributing towards development and operations of an existing cloud based server application. development and operations of experimental product development projects. below is a sample of technologies you may explore: block chain / crypto currency business intelligence, machine learning and ai server-less architecture - micro-service architecture ios/android and mobile app development e-commerce development about rebel  we celebrate contribution. we work hard and we respect balance. we’re agile, open concept and collaborative.  we stock our kitchen so you can grab breakfast, lunch and snacks anytime. we’re smoke free but love beer. we are located in downtown ottawa’s byward market, but we are also accepting applications from those who live outside of ottawa and are willing to work remotely. non-smokers only, please! technology company located in waterloo, ontario. rave's two main product lines are a synchronous media viewing platform on mobile and in vr, and the first artificial intelligence dj, capable of autonomously mixing music together.regarding the rave app, it's available on ios, android, samsung galaxy gear vr, and google daydream vr. rave enables users to enjoy content from youtube, vimeo, viki, google drive, dropbox, and ravedj. rave syncs playback down to the millisecond, allowing users to create local speaker systems from their phones. when users are distant, they can chat over text and speak on voip while they watch videos and listen to music. rave is a combination of the best elements of a media player and a messenger.ravedj utilizes machine learning to process, analyzing, and artfully combine user-selected music into mixes, or "mashups". users have created hundreds of thousands of mashups at www.rave.dj, such as thunder vs turn down for what (https://rave.dj/aqwogz6wvymaqw), wild thoughts vs sua casa (https://rave.dj/f9swjfxqgeyhga), and napal baji vs. uptown funk (https://www.rave.dj/j1opsiyckdddra).job summarydeveloping an algorithm title: Data Scientist
text: wish - data scientistdata scientisttoronto, canadaengineering - torontofull-timeapply for this jobdata driven decision-making is an integral part of life at wish. it drives our success with customers and merchants. we’re looking for a talented data scientist to continue to drive decisions company-wide through the use of statistical modeling and machine learning.you should have an extensive background in a quantitative field, a strong research background, and experience working with large data sets. you should be results-driven, highly motivated, and have a track record of using data analytics to drive the understanding, growth, and the success of a product.responsibilities:analyze web scale data to discover patterns and provide actionable insightsresearch and develop statistical learning modelscollaborate with product, engineering and business teams to define and design algorithmic solutionsstay up-to-date with latest technology trends and apply advanced algorithms to improve customer experience and/or increase marketplace efficiencysupport all iterations of data driven product feature development from algorithm design, production implementation to experimentation and measurementrequirements:advanced degree in computer science, electrical engineering or statistics4+ years experience in machine learning, deep learning, computer vision, or a related fieldhands on experience with large scale data processing software and tools (hadoop, spark, mapreduce etc)strong coding experience and knowledge of object oriented programmingexperience in management and a good publication record are a pluscompany descriptionwish brings together top technical talent from google, facebook, linkedin, uber, pinterest, and yahoo! real-time biophysical & biochemical quality analysis
the foodsafe analyzers provide a fully integrated, real-time food quality analysis tool. the integration of cutting-edge hardware and software technology allows for non-destructive quantitative and qualitative measurements of fresh food products. your desired biochemical and biophysical quality metrics are extracted and analyzed using advanced artificial intelligence algorithms. our team of food scientists and engineers will train the algorithms to help achieve the business outcomes you desire. 
















 






shelf-life prediction & decay curves
savormetrics’ devices and algorithms accurately predict decay curves, providing an estimate of the remaining shelf-life of food products. combining this information with your custom thresholds, the software assists with:smart buying practices,smarter inventory management,smart pricing practices,supply & demand predictionsthis results in reduction in spoilage expenses and an increase in revenue. 
















 






artificial intelligence & machine learning
this is the “brain” of all of our systems. we apply our advanced artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms to:develop new, more meaningful food quality metrics,develop taste metrics,predict shelf-life,predict best time to harvest,predict ripening processes,predict yields for food processing applications,identify contaminants,track the movement of foods and predict it’s impact on quality metrics through the food supply chain,develop efficient grading classifications 
















 






business decision support software
savormetrics’ software translates your data into meaningful business knowledge for you.  we will work with your staff to identify meaningful quality thresholds to meet your business needs.you and your staff will not need to waste time on interpreting scientific data.  data will be presented in a customized manner that provide decision-making support to your staff along your supply chain.  a workflow element is incorporated into the decision support software design allowing for seamless integration into your business process.  these elements may include task tracking, alerts, red flags and reporting.

senior data scientist - image processing specialisthamilton position overview:the senior data scientist - image processing specialist, reporting to the cto and collaborating closely with senior data scientist – machine based learning specialist, contributes to the research and development of various sensing solutions across multiple application verticals in nanolytix inc. one of the primary areas of focus is the food sector, nanolytix is an industry leader in rapid testing technology and shelf life extension in the food sector. our sensing devices are both optical and nanowire-based, they are used to detect characteristics in food as well as the presence of pathogens, contaminants, and other small molecules. our software applications make our devices easy to use while providing advanced data for customer specific needs and for big data analysis that support our customers in making effective decisions.the successful individual will immediately contribute to addressing the software needs concerning image processing, analysis, and interpretation for various sensing technologies available for various applications. involvement in the design and development of any future technologies with a focus on the design, build, test, implementation, and maintenance of agile and efficient cross-platform data acquisition and analytics is strongly encouraged.this position may require some local travel. this position may require working hour flexibility due to time-zone differences with collaborative partners.the position is contract.accountabilities:under the general direction of the cto, the image processing scientist is responsible to:participate and take a leading role in all analytics software design and development requirements,propose, design, and implement analytics software solutions for the suite of sensors and sensing products,propose, design, and implement interpretation software solutions for the suite of sensors and sensing products,understand overall customer product requirements and how they relate to software design,using research/customer data sets, develop new algorithms for increased accuracy and efficiency for hardware
