title: NSERC Data Researcher
text: mobify - nserc data researchernserc data researchervancouverproductinternapply for this jobwe’re looking for nserc data researchers to join our team! here at mobify, we track large amounts of data and are interested in establishing collaboration with academia to establish some potential research opportunities.  as a data researcher, you’re responsible for analyzing data mobify collects with our engagement engine. our engagement engine collects online behaviour of shoppers. in this six-month internship, you’ll come up with insights and recommendations about how mobify can engage with shoppers.what you'll doidentify clear hypotheses from the data and validate with various stakeholdersexecute on a proposed research project in iterations and provide regular demoswork in collaboration with data engineering team to validate accuracy of data and ensure that prototypes don’t have critical flaws that could not be scaledperform ad hoc analysis as neededbe an internal advocate for data - showcase your passion for data by presenting and promoting newly discovered insights who you areyou are eligible for the full funding from the nserc programyou are currently enrolled in a graduate program with concentrations in mathematics / computer science / statistics / economics / physics related programs. you have intermediate/advanced understanding of statistics or machine learningyou have previous experience working on projects requiring delivered results and demos +2 years in academic studyyou have +2 years programming experience in data processing languages (e.g. matlab, r, python, fortran) about usat mobify, we’re passionate about delivering next-level mobile experiences. we power shopping around the world through web, apps, and bricks and mortar stores to help retailers achieve a truly omnichannel presence.we love coming to work every day because of the people who surround us - the friendly and supportive environment ensures that everyone feels welcome. mobify is an equal opportunity employer and encourages people of all backgrounds and experience levels to apply.apply for this jobjobs powered by

title: Machine Learning Developer
text:
coveo careers - machine learning developer




























 


















                machine learning developer
    
    

                            research and development            
                    quebec,
                            qc
                
                        



        apply
    


description

position at coveo careers


blown away by the latest news about netflix recommendations algorithms? can’t get enough of learning about the logic behind amazon’s purchase suggestions? we believe you have found your chance to put your experience and vast knowledge of machine learning, data science and ai to work!become an ai guruwe are on the lookout for an ai connoisseur to make a brand new addition to our brilliant machine learning team. you are well-versed in a few programming languages (ex: scala and python) and large-scale data analysis platforms like spark. you have worked professionally on several ml, nlp or ai projects in the past and have proven yourself to be a talented, well-rounded and well-informed expert on the subject. here is what we have in store for you on a typical day:your day begins at the time of your choosing (no fixed schedule!), you pour yourself a fresh (free) cup of coffee you take part in the daily scrum meeting to be well aware of where your team is at and bounce a few ideas aroundback to your desk (or other work station) to continue working on the development of a few new algorithms you’re currently evaluating and testingyou show your colleagues the results of the tests you ran yesterday on a new algorithm that will revolutionise the intelligent search industryyou challenge your teammates on their hard work - we believe in rigorous code reviews to maintain an equilibrium between code performance, robustness, and elegance.you can expect to use the following tools on a daily basis: our coveo cloud platform, intellij idea/eclipse, spark, amazon web services (aws), jira, bitbucket (mercurial), google docs/sheets (to document tests and experiments), slack.tell me more...as a machine learning developer, you will be encouraged to innovate and bring ideas to the table. you will have the opportunity to :design, develop and improve our machine learning algorithms for our search toolimprove our personalised search recommendations, automatic user grouping and auto-configuration of algorithms for each client/organisationpersonalise search results scheduling for each client/organisationexperiment and compare the impact of recent changes on our algorithms’ performance metricsidentify relevant usage patterns within the tens of thousands of data collected everydayanalyse certain client cases to suggest improvementssupport our production team by analysing reported bugs and correcting accordinglyand if you’re still not convinced:what is coveo all about? the best information. everywhere. every time. recognized as the leader in intelligent search and insights, coveo enables users to benefit from the latest, most relevant information for their needs, via a traditional search box or contextualized content recommendations. major companies such as adobe, logitech and gopro use coveo to better answer their customer inquiries, facilitate self-service, accelerate innovation and sell more (and better).what is it like to work at coveo? you’ll come to join a team of passionate people with an innovative mindset that constantly push the envelope. then you’ll enjoy learning with the best, the empowerment and trust from the leadership and the major projects you’ll be given leadership on. and you’ll stay for the « work hard play hard » mentality; we sweat it off at work and know how to have fun and facilitate a balance with your personal life. for all these reasons,coveo has been awarded the grand and gold stevie awards for great employers in 2016.

chercheur apprentissage-automatique (machine learning)
date de début de l'affichage
 8 septembre 2017
entreprise
umanx
cible
être titulaire d'une maîtrise ou d’un doctorat en informatique, intelligence artificielle ou un domaine technique connexe
courte description de l'offre
description de l'entreprise
umanx est une entreprise de robotique mobile. notre vision est un monde où les humains sont libres des tâches manuelles, répétitives ou dangereuses. l’intelligence et la créativité sont des qualités humaines inestimables; notre mission est de les libérer
 
description du poste
responsabilités
vous travaillerez sur la conception et le développement en intelligence artificielle associés aux technologies d’umanx:

développer des algorithmes de reconnaissance visuelle et vocale
développer des méthodes d’apprentissage-automatique appliquées à la robotique mobile
entraîner des réseaux de neurones à reconnaitre des situations anormales selon l'information de plus de 25 capteurs
programmer et optimiser la fiabilité des algorithmes classiques de détection de situations anormales
concevoir, implémenter et optimiser les algorithmes en langage c++
participer aux autres activités de développement logiciel d'umanx
tester et valider expérimentalement les algorithmes et méthodes développées

 
qualifications

être titulaire d'une maîtrise ou d’un doctorat en informatique, intelligence artificielle ou un domaine technique connexe
posséder une expérience pertinente en développement de méthodes d’apprentissage-automatique
avoir une bonne connaissance du langage c++, python ou matlab
compréhension des techniques de pointe en matière d’apprentissage-automatique
avoir une bonne base en mathématique
être capable de bien s'exprimer en français et en anglais, tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit
être autonome, minutieux et un travailleur d’équipe hors pair

 
si vous êtes passionné par la robotique, nous avons besoin de vous pour bâtir notre équipe r&d. soyez parmi les premiers employés, devenez un pilier de la compagnie et partagez pleinement notre succès

job description 




data science team lead
 

grossman dorland recruiting (gdr) has been growing canada’s tech ecosystem for 10 years. we match top talent and executives with leading startups, tech companies and innovation labs, and grow leadership capacity through individual and organizational coaching. our goal is to advise tech talent and organizations throughout their entire growth journey.

gdr is recruiting a data science team lead for an innovation group within a global, fortune 500 company leading the it industry. start-up like opportunity will consist of a research team of 45 members to expand ai initiatives. toronto team will have a huge impact on product advances for millions of users worldwide.
 
company overview:
- focus is on three pillars: research, engineering and prototyping.
- headquarters in silicon valley.
- toronto office will be around the mars discovery district.
- extended benefits and 3 weeks vacation.
 

you will thrive as data science team lead if you have…
- leadership experience.
- experience with machine learning and analytics.
- expertise in areas including predictive models, information retrieval and pattern recognition.
- worked with data management platforms such as kafka, spark and hadoop.
 

as data science team lead you will...
- build, lead and mentor the data science team in toronto.
- identify bottlenecks and resolve issues using data analytics.
- actively seek for new technologies and present these recommendations.
- work with other teams to deploy product and ensure seamless integration.
 

apply today for the data science team lead role or contact brandon shim-ping, director, talent, at brandon at grossmandorland dot com to learn more.
 


gdr values inclusion in canada’s tech ecosystem and partners with employers that provide equal opportunities for individuals from diverse groups. while we welcome tech talent from overseas, only candidates legally authorized to work in canada will be considered.
 

follow gdr on linkedin, twitter and facebook for updates on new roles in tech.

$75,000 - $100,000 a year - contract position descriptionthe kimel family translational imaging-genetics laboratory is a large multidisciplinary research laboratory dedicated to discovering the causes of severe mental illness and advancing treatments for severe mental illness. the focus of the laboratory is on combining brain imaging and genetics, brain imaging and brain stimulation, and brain imaging and clinical trials. the laboratory is located in the research imaging centre.the research methods specialist’s primary responsibility will be to collaborate and support laboratory members and subject matter experts in design, development and implementation of analyses and new methods, as well as provide guidance, technical advice and training. the successful candidate will also be involved in the maintenance of different analysis pipelines and will help users migrate existing software to high performance computing infrastructures (such as the scinet facilities). additionally, the research methods specialist will be involved in the system administration of a computing cluster that is used in the daily research endeavours of scientists, fellows, and trainees. in this role you will manage both user access and hardware of the cluster. you will support a healthy workplace that embraces diversity encourages teamwork and complies with all applicable standards and requirements. this position will be located at 250 college street.qualifications: the successful applicant must possess an honor’s baccalaureate degrees in computer science, engineering, physics, mathematics or neuroscience combined with a minimum of five (5) years of related experience is required including two (2) years in software development or research programming role. a master’s degree would be an asset. knowledge and experience are required in software development techniques (e.g. design principles, automated testing, version control), and software development in python, shell and r. previous experience in system administration (installing/ configuring software from source, user management, and backup and system security) is also required. experience dealing with neuroimaging data or multivariate statistical methods (e.g. machine learning methods) is a considerable asset. the successful candidate will have demonstrated analytical and creative problem-solving abilities and knowledge of state of the art technology, equipment and compute cluster systems. the ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues and diverse stakeholders is essential. demonstrated communications skills (both oral and written) are required as is the ability to explain complex issues in plain language. the candidate will be detail oriented, well organized, with the ability to meet deadlines and to work independently with minimal supervision. candidates require the ability to work effectively with individuals from diverse backgrounds. bilingualism (french/english) or proficiency in a second language would be an asset.please note: this full-time, contract position lasting one year is part of the opseu bargaining unitsalary range: $35.77 – $48.24 per hourapply title: Data Scientist
text: data scientist job at plantiga technologies inc. in vancouver, british columbia, canada, powered by jobscore your browser cookies must be enabled in order to apply for this job. please contact support@jobscore.com if you need further instruction on how to do that. data scientist software engineering | vancouver, british columbia, canada | full time job description about us: plantiga is a human analytics company that leverages the fusion of wearable hardware, cloud computing and machine learning to provide real-time predictive analytics for performance, health and safety. the company has developed a novel flexible footwear sensor that produces lab grade gait analytics in a mobile environment. combined with an advanced software back-end, the tiga system is a new type of motion capture. we aim to be the world leader in foot/ground interaction data, and are pioneering “human movement intelligence”. we are looking for a data scientist to join us in changing the world of motion capture and movement analytics. responsibilities: validate and improve the accuracy of plantiga’s algorithms and analytics.  develop novel algorithms that provide value to customers.  create data munging pipeline to clean data for large scale analytics processing.  create ground truth labelled data to infuse human knowledge into our ai platform.  work closely with the upper management to implement projects contributing to product development.  requirements: -- we don't expect them all but here's a good list of what we would love to see -- technical skills:  minimum two years experience in a data scientist / machine learning position.  experienced in machine learning, statistics, and data analytics methods.  working knowledge of digital signal processing such as ffts, filter design, wavelets.  working knowledge of deep learning frameworks and algorithms.  previous experience working with time series data from imus, medical devices, car sensors, or similar.  excellent data visualization skills to communicate knowledge from data.  experience with motion capture and computer vision is a plus.  abilities:  experience taking ideas from conception to release.  critical thinker with an ability to identify root causes of problems.  able to achieve consensus across teams and drive product execution.  thrive in a fast-paced iterative development environment.  highly organized and ability to be self-managed toward assigned tasks.  core competence:  b.sc./m.sc. in mathematics, physics, or engineering disciplines such as computer engineering, mechatronics, engineering physics, applied mathematics.  proficient in scientific computing platforms such as r, python (including numpy, scipy, pandas, matplotlib), or matlab.  experience in a deep learning framework such as tensorflow, theano, torch, etc.  solid understanding of digital signal processing. perks: our office is located in historic railtown, at 611 alexander. it boasts 18" ceilings and brick and beam architecture.  we are a fun group that puts collaboration, good energy and fun above most things. we do beer fridays where friends, family and colleagues can down for a beverage (or senior data scientist - global center of competence (coc)

job description


ibm global business services (gbs) is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants enabling enterprises to make smarter decisions and providing unparalleled client and consumer experiences in cognitive, data analytics, cloud technology and mobile app development. with global reach, outcome-focused methodologies and deep industry expertise, ibm gbs empowers clients to digitally reinvent their business and get the competitive edge in the cognitive era in over 170 countries. bottom line? we outthink ordinary. discover what you can do at ibm.the center of competence (coc) is the recognized leader for delivering solutions to clients across all industries and verticals. we combine the latest technologies with the technical depth of ibm and our extensive network of partners to design and implement innovative solutions to our client.  we are now expanding our team and looking for senior data scientists who are a recognized authority in their area of expertise and have a proven track record of success. the senior data scientist is an experienced practitioner in the areas of statistics, data mining and machine learning as applied to numerical, time series and text data.  they will help clients understand the potential meaning that can be extracted from a variety of data sources by applying big data analytics, statistics and machine learning techniques.  they will further help clients understand how these insights can lead to greater operational efficiency and new business opportunities.  a senior data scientist is also responsible for presenting data and results visually in ways that support understanding of the extracted meaning. key responsibilities include:provide quantitative and business analytic skills to develop and implement solutionsdefine key business problems to be solved and formulate mathematical approaches to solve those given problemsform and maintain trusted relationships with clients and serve as the 'go to' contactapply oral and written communication skills to proposal development, client presentations and deliverable creation create software assets that can be deployed as services and redeployed with new clientscollaborate with subject matter experts and data scientists in ibm research in the coc, the senior data scientist will have the opportunity to contribute right away to top tier clients in collaboration with others in a dynamic team environment.  the senior data scientist will work on projects that help clients integrate strategy and technology to increase effectiveness, reduce costs, and improve profit and shareholder value. the senior data scientist will have an opportunity to build a powerful portfolio of interesting and rewarding experiences. the ideal candidate will have experiences in at least one of the following areas, with the opportunity to develop and strengthen abilities in other areas:  data analytics and modeling, data visualization, business acumen and strategy.  you can take advantage of opportunities to master new skills, work across different disciplines and move into new challenges....all at ibm, a company that is at the forefront of tackling the grand challenges that affect our society. when not traveling nationally and globally, practitioners on this team will report to work in armonk, ny or nyc area.  must be willing to travel up to 75% benefitshealth insurance. paid time off. corporate holidays. sick leave. family planning. financial guidance. competitive 401k. training and learning. we continue to expand our benefits and programs, offering some of the best support, guidance and coverage for a diverse employee population.ibm.com/employment/us/benefits/ibm.com/press/us/en/pressrelease/50744.wsscareer growthour goal is to be essential to the world, which starts with our people.  company wide we kicked off an internal strategy program called go organic.  at our core, we are committed to believing and investing in our workforce through:skill development: helping our employees grow their foundational skillsfinding the dream job at ibm: navigating our company with the potential for many careers by channeling an employee’s strengths and career aspirationsdiversity of people: diversity of thought driving collective innovationin 2015, go organic filled approximately 50% of our open positions with internal talent that were promoted into the role.corporate citizenshipwith an employee population of 375,000 in over 170 countries, amazingly we connect, collaborate, and care. ibmers drive a corporate culture of shared responsibility. we love grand challenges and everyday improvements for our company and for the world. we care about each other, our clients, and the communities we live, work, and play in!ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/initiatives.htmlibm.com/ibm/responsibility/corporateservicecorps/

title: Software Engineer - Compilers
text:
software engineer - compilers at tenstorrent tenstorrentsoftware engineer - compilers full-time in  toronto, onnumber of openings: 2 (1 senior, 1 junior)
at tenstorrent, we are building a new processor optimized for deep learning. our vision is that the next quantum leap in efficacy of deep learning will be unlocked by joint optimization of algorithms and the hardware on which they run. our solution is software programmable and promises to dramatically improve efficiency in comparison to the current state of the art. our technical team is highly experienced, with a long list of pioneering semiconductor and software products under its belt. we highly value transparency, integrity and team work. we strive for a culture that is informal, yet very professional.
aside from the rare opportunity to contribute to a brand-new processor architecture, we offer a rate of learning and career progress that is only achievable at early stage companies, as well as highly competitive compensation and benefits. this is your chance to become one of the first members of a fast-growing team working on cutting edge technology.
as a compiler engineer, you will work closely with a deep learning expert to define and implement an efficient and easy-to-use toolchain bridging deep learning frameworks and our processor hardware. you will be solving challenging optimization problems by researching and implementing state-of-the art algorithms. the result of your effort will dramatically contribute to the overall performance of the processor, and your experiments and results will guide hardware architecture improvements.
responsibilities:

design and implement a set of compiler tools to translate from ml-oriented domain-specific languages (tensorflow, caffe, theano) to proprietary binary format
implement scheduling and parallel processing algorithms for our parallel processor
measure performance and optimize for hardware efficiency
design, develop, document, and maintain in-house software tools

qualifications:

excellent proficiency in c++ and c
experience with parallel algorithms and distributed systems
work experience with compilers, graph manipulation algorithms, or ic/fpga cad software
solid understanding of computer architecture
work experience with machine learning frameworks

if you like solving hard problems and enjoy bringing complex systems to life, we would love to talk to you!

title: R&D: MACHINE LEARNING AND DATA ANALYTIC
Data Science (Team Lead)
text:
data science (team lead) - unata inc. - job board view our website view all jobs data science (team lead) toronto, ontario, canada full time data science manager/supervisor lead data scientist  who are we? unata is a group of talented individuals who are on a mission to shape the grocery shopping experience of the future. we are an award-winning, product-focused company that powers digital grocery experiences for our highly-respected grocery partners to better serve their hundreds of thousands of shoppers. we provide a white-label platform for large retail grocery chains that provides a complete and unified digital customer experience, interweaving ecommerce, ecircular, and digital loyalty. a key differentiator is that every single customer touchpoint is automatically 1-to-1 personalized through our proprietary personalization technology. unata is headquartered in toronto, on and empowers respected retailers including lowes foods, longo’s, lunds & byerly’s, and raley’s. what makes working at unata so great? working with dedicated people that want to make an impact. this ain’t no another-day-another-dollar gig. a working environment where your opinions are valued. a team that appreciates learning new technologies and implementing them when they make sense. attending various developer conferences like pycon where our team is regularly selected to present. competitive compensation and stock options. stocked-up fridge full of food and beer. totally-optional, totally-fun activities every month, coordinated by our very own manager of happiness, plus the regular ping pong battles or board games in the office every friday. what are we looking for? tldr; unata is looking for a technical leader of our data science team. you might be the right fit for us if you’re an accomplished, seasoned, battle-scarred data scientist with a history of enterprise software (ideally saas). data science at unata is the foundation of everything we do to personalize the experience of our end users. your team will become the pillar of a mature data culture within unata. you’ll need to be ready to hit the keyboard from day one, even as you hire new team members to expand our capabilities (i.e. prepare to roll up your sleeves!). you love co-owning a product and building a team, company, and customer base around it. you’re a passionate believer in culture and leadership.   what will you be doing? the data science team at unata owns the following areas of our product: recommendations, analytics, and search. as director, you will be directly involved and contribute to the design, software engineering, and testing of those systems. you’ll be responsible for the architecture and engineering of our data, and the development of predictive algorithms and machine learning that will drive recommendations, analysis and insights into how our platform is being used by our partners. moreover, you’ll be responsible for educating and inspiring your fellow team members on the importance of data in everything we do.   requirements, requirements, requirements degree in software engineering, computer science, etc. excellent object-oriented software design skills, and strong knowledge of python (+ for pandas, scikits learn, numpy). excellent understanding of machine learning foundations. solid grasp of computer science concepts: data structures, algorithms, and programming paradigms. we are very keen on implementing red-black trees here at unata. you understand and implement engineering best practices: automated testing, version control systems, documentation, continuous integration, duct tape redundancy, etc. you feel at home (cd ~) in a unix development environment. you can clearly communicate complex technical concepts. you have built and shipped real software. you know… flappy bird clones… all that jazz. you can demonstrate and talk about your willingness to learn new things. like that new reactive microservice framework everyone’s been deploying on docker lately. bonus points! experience with the following technologies (c-c-c-c-combo breaker!): distributed data-stores and frameworks like apache cassandra, apache kafka, elasticsearch, mapreduce. rdbms (+ for postgresql). cool personal projects on github or other places, participation in kaggle competitions. oh! and a willingness to be the greatest ping pong player in the world (or the office).   read more apply for position apply for this position required* apply with linkedin apply with indeed apply with indeed first name* last name* email address* title: Applied Research Scientist
text:
job application for applied research scientist at element ai





















          apply now
        
applied research scientist

        at element ai
      
(view all jobs)

        toronto
      


we are putting together a world-class research and development team to build a platform enabling next generation ai-first businesses. as a research engineer in machine learning you will enjoy a unique opportunity to use your creativity both to pursue fundamental research and to apply cutting-edge techniques within applied projects. you will face diversified challenges and you may end up working on time-series, images, videos, control problems, etc. while doing so you will have access to the best hardware and you will be assisted by a team of it experts and software developers, to ensure most of your time is spent on core r&d challenges.
our research agenda covers many subjects and, based on your interests and our needs, you could explore generative models, reinforcement learning, constraint programming, etc. you will collaborate closely both with software developers and with scientists. in particular, you'll get the opportunity to discuss weekly with world-class academics from our faculty fellowship program, such as aaron courville, joelle pineau, christopher pal and doina precup. these collaborations will often lead to publications in the most important journals and conferences.
you have experience in machine learning, either through graduate studies or industrial r&d projects. you're also a solid programmer and you're comfortable doing scientific programming as well as product development. you can understand and implement techniques exposed in academic papers in your field.
you want to join us because you are passionate about:

fundamental research in machine learning;
explaining the data audit and data quality control to partners and clients;
exploring the wide variety of contexts and situations in which ml can be applied;
working with huge datasets and finding unexpected signal in them;
using and discovering the best tools to build working prototypes of ai services;
coding high-quality production code and continuously learning the best practices to turn research into delightful products;
building strong collaborative relationship with scientists, software developers, and program directors;
staying up-to-date on the scientific literature in your field, and even contributing to it by publishing in famous journals and conferences.

we want you to join us because you have:

a getting-things-done mindset with a desire not only to push the boundary of fundamental knowledge, but to turn it into products people love;
a ph.d or m.sc. in machine learning or a quantitative field and at least 3 years of industrial r&d experience;
the seniority of the candidate will be established through the interview process;​
a more experienced candidate could evolve into a leadership position as we grow the team;
experience and mastery of scientific programming and libraries relevant to your field for example: theano, tensorflow​, numpy, r, etc.; 
experience with at least one of the following programming language, preferably for the development of production code: python, c++, scala, go, c#, f# , javascript, java, etc.; 
an open mind and a desire to learn the best language/technology to solve a given problem;
experience working in a diversified team;
a history of shipping high quality code using cutting-edge techniques.

what we offer for your valuable work:

highly dynamic, innovative, passionate, intrapreneurial team;
open and inclusive company culture;
worldwide competitive salary; 
participation in the company success through the employee stock option plan;
participation in company employee benefits program;
flexible hours (outside of core hours);
autonomous, self-managed agile teams.
we strongly believe in collocated team dynamic. we would be happy to work with you if you can join the team in our montreal office.

we are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

help center log in about careers press and media enterprise sitemap back to job listings choose your own data engineering adventure... ottawa, montreal, toronto, waterloo hi there! we realise that this is a bit of an unusual title to find in a careers page, but we wanted to try something a little different. working on the data side of engineering at shopify is an incredibly vibrant and exciting place to be and we've posted a lot of roles that speak to specific challenges that we're currently tackling. the thing is, we know there are talented folks out there who may not see the exact role they're looking for when perusing this page and that's a real shame. so we're opening the floor to you! we've listed the most common engineering roles you'll find in the data org here at shopify below - take a gander and if any of these roles seem particularly interesting, we'd love to hear from you!data engineer: work with product and business users to determine how datasets should be built, along with how success is defined, and the metrics to measure itdata platform engineer: deploying and maintaining a variety of scalable technologies for extracting and transforming a multitude of different sources of datadata infrastructure engineer: the focus is on automation, tooling, and scripting to develop and increase the reliability of the platform that powers our data decisionsbackend engineer - data: building applications around merchant reporting & analytics as well as internal data toolsetsmachine learning engineer: focusing on merchant optimization and merchant services algorithms, using things like machine learning to build the shopify brain.we have folks in these roles across all our offices, so be sure to let us know which location you'd prefer along with the type of role that caught your eye. we're really looking forward to hearing from you! interested in applying? that's great!if you’re interested in joining us as an engineer within the data & analytics organization, click the “apply now” button up in the corner. and remember, we really want to know what you're really interested in building and why you want to build it at shopify, so please give us as much detail as you'd like in your cover letter- we do love a good story. 👍 📖note: if you have already applied to one of our existing data roles on the career page, there is no need to repeat your application here. apply now or, know someone who would be a perfect fit? let them know! share on twitter share on facebook not what you’re looking for? don’t worry, we’re growing and exciting jobs come up often. sign up to receive email updates when other data & analytics jobs are posted. emailget notified thank you! we also encourage those who are interested in shopify to start a store to see what you think. get started. start your 14-day free trial today! emailget started completely risk free. no credit card required. about careers press and media enterprise sitemap online store sell online features examples website editor online retail ecommerce website domain names themes shopping cart ecommerce hosting mobile commerce ecommerce software online store builder dropshipping point of sale point of sale features hardware pos software support 24/7 support shopify help center forums api documentation free tools free stock photos websites for sale shopify contact partner program affiliate program app developers investors blog topics facebook twitter youtube instagram linkedin pinterest google plus snapchat terms of service privacy policy usachange your country or region. usacanada (english)canada (français)australiabrasilespañamexicocolombiaespañolfranceirelandindiaindonesiaitalia日本malaysianew zealandnigeriaphilippinesrussiasingaporesouth africaunited kingdom

data scientist


location:

# of openings:
1


 



description
looking for a new and exciting challenge?
never heard of mindgeek? mindgeek is a company specializing in the development and marketing of highly trafficked web properties; a leader in its activity. but that’s only what we do, not who we are. so who are we? the best way to describe us would be nothing less than awesome! an overstatement? we don’t think so. and neither will you if you come work with us!
as a data scientist you will be responsible for analyzing complex data patterns in order to find new solutions to specific technical or business challenges within the area of web publishing and marketing. we expect you to have a solid training in computer science, software development, modeling, statistics and mathematics or any related quantitative field. you also have good business knowledge and a strong sense of initiative and adventure. you will work closely with technical and business teams to find innovative approaches to the various data processing challenges that our organization faces.
you will work on various systems like content recommendation engines, ad bidding systems, credit card fraud detection solutions, anomalous web traffic detection, and much more. 
responsibilities:

review recent technological and research advances from the community and integrate them with existing architecture
architect, develop and implement systems to optimize revenue, views and engagement
meet, communicate and present findings to internal clients
find creative solutions to current issues and identify new opportunities
develop and implement solutions including applying algorithms, improving existing algorithms, and developing custom algorithms
provide expert advice and assistance to other teams in the company

requirements:

m.sc. in data mining, machine learning, statistics, mathematics or similar field - ph.d. an asset
strong knowledge and proficiency in data mining algorithms including decision trees, probability networks, clustering, regression and neural networks
research-oriented and strong passion for empirical research on hard problems
strong programming skills in r, java, python or similar high-level languages
ability to present results to non-expert people

preferred qualifications:

familiarity with database environments and functional knowledge of sql.
experience with samza, kafka, yarn and other distributed and big data solutions
experience with unix/linux environment
experience and ability to work with big data problems
data science side project or kaggle competitions an asset

 
mindgeek offers its employees a competitive compensation plan and various perks including...

annual bonus plans and benefits package
flex and summer hours
tuition, conferences and training reimbursement program
discounts for nearby businesses and a 500$ yearly gym/fitness allowance
access to onsite ping-pong, foosball and pool tables
access to onsite cafeteria including a daily free complete breakfast (bacon and eggs on friday)
… and much more!

    
don’t be shy, apply. but only if you’re up for the challenge of a lifetime!
we thank all applicants for their interest, however only candidates under consideration will be contacted. no telephone calls please. no agency calls or emails.

title: Data Scientist
text:
maple leaf sports & entertainment career opportunities
































data scientist


employment duration:
full time


department:
marketing & creative services


location:
air canada centre


job code:
3595


closing date:
11/10/17



description
company overview
maple leaf sports & entertainment partnership (mlse) is one of north america’s leading providers of unimaginable experiences. we are the parent company of the toronto maple leafs (nhl), toronto raptors (nba), toronto fc (mls), and toronto marlies (ahl). our talented group of professionals are accountable for delivering everything our teams need to win. at the end of the day, our mission is simple: bring the world to its feet.
position overview
mlse is looking for a highly motivated and energetic data scientist to join our data science practice.  the mlse fans engage with the organization through multiple channels and generates vast swaths of information. our data scientists will be responsible to create high quality datasets and develop data science tools to drive fan experiences and services.
our data scientist will need extensive data modelling and data warehouse experience:

machine learning on large datasets
data preparation and transformation using hive, pig and spark
data warehousing concepts including facts, dimensions, star schemas
implementing etl process in data pipeline
design and deploy of systems to enable folks to consume and understand data faster
architect, build and launch new data models using python 3.0 or scala that provide intuitive insights to our stakeholders

responsibilities

work with large datasets to solve difficult non-routine analysis problems that enables mlse to elevate fan experience
conduct end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables and presentation
build and prototype analysis pipelines iteratively to provide insights at scale
analytical model development, design, and operational deployment
interact cross-functionally with a wide variety of people and teams. work closely with the mobile product team and brand teams to identify opportunities for, design, and assess improvements to mobile products/content
build recommendation systems to create best and next-best product offerings

requirements

expert level of data science development (spark, python, scala, julia), database languages (sql, hive) and apis
demonstrated skills in selecting the right statistical/ml tools given a data analysis problem
proven ability to develop partnerships with technical peers and business unit leaders
educational background in a quantitative field
entrepreneurial spirit and smart creative personality
team first, positive, people-oriented, and energetic attitude

we thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
maple leaf sports & entertainment partnership will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in the job application process. if you have difficulty using our online application system and/or you need an accommodation due to a disability, please email accommodations@mlse.com.

job description


ibm global business services (gbs) is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants enabling enterprises to make smarter decisions and providing unparalleled client and consumer experiences in cognitive, data analytics, cloud technology and mobile app development. with global reach, outcome-focused methodologies and deep industry expertise, ibm gbs empowers clients to digitally reinvent their business and get the competitive edge in the cognitive era in over 170 countries. bottom line? we outthink ordinary. discover what you can do at ibm.the center of competence (coc) is the recognized leader for delivering solutions to clients across all industries and verticals. we combine the latest technologies with the technical depth of ibm and our extensive network of partners to design and implement innovative solutions to our client.  we are now expanding our team and looking for senior data scientists who are a recognized authority in their area of expertise and have a proven track record of success. the senior data scientist is an experienced practitioner in the areas of statistics, data mining and machine learning as applied to numerical, time series and text data.  they will help clients understand the potential meaning that can be extracted from a variety of data sources by applying big data analytics, statistics and machine learning techniques.  they will further help clients understand how these insights can lead to greater operational efficiency and new business opportunities.  a senior data scientist is also responsible for presenting data and results visually in ways that support understanding of the extracted meaning. key responsibilities include:provide quantitative and business analytic skills to develop and implement solutionsdefine key business problems to be solved and formulate mathematical approaches to solve those given problemsform and maintain trusted relationships with clients and serve as the 'go to' contactapply oral and written communication skills to proposal development, client presentations and deliverable creation create software assets that can be deployed as services and redeployed with new clientscollaborate with subject matter experts and data scientists in ibm research in the coc, the senior data scientist will have the opportunity to contribute right away to top tier clients in collaboration with others in a dynamic team environment.  the senior data scientist will work on projects that help clients integrate strategy and technology to increase effectiveness, reduce costs, and improve profit and shareholder value. the senior data scientist will have an opportunity to build a powerful portfolio of interesting and rewarding experiences. the ideal candidate will have experiences in at least one of the following areas, with the opportunity to develop and strengthen abilities in other areas:  data analytics and modeling, data visualization, business acumen and strategy.  you can take advantage of opportunities to master new skills, work across different disciplines and move into new challenges....all at ibm, a company that is at the forefront of tackling the grand challenges that affect our society. when not traveling nationally and globally, practitioners on this team will report to work in armonk, ny or nyc area.  must be willing to travel up to 75% benefitshealth insurance. paid time off. corporate holidays. sick leave. family planning. financial guidance. competitive 401k. training and learning. we continue to expand our benefits and programs, offering some of the best support, guidance and coverage for a diverse employee population.ibm.com/employment/us/benefits/ibm.com/press/us/en/pressrelease/50744.wsscareer growthour goal is to be essential to the world, which starts with our people.  company wide we kicked off an internal strategy program called go organic.  at our core, we are committed to believing and investing in our workforce through:skill development: helping our employees grow their foundational skillsfinding the dream job at ibm: navigating our company with the potential for many careers by channeling an employee’s strengths and career aspirationsdiversity of people: diversity of thought driving collective innovationin 2015, go organic filled approximately 50% of our open positions with internal talent that were promoted into the role.corporate citizenshipwith an employee population of 375,000 in over 170 countries, amazingly we connect, collaborate, and care. ibmers drive a corporate culture of shared responsibility. we love grand challenges and everyday improvements for our company and for the world. we care about each other, our clients, and the communities we live, work, and play in!ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/initiatives.htmlibm.com/ibm/responsibility/corporateservicecorps/

title: Software Engineer - Compilers
text:
software engineer - compilers at tenstorrent tenstorrentsoftware engineer - compilers full-time in  toronto, onnumber of openings: 2 (1 senior, 1 junior)
at tenstorrent, we are building a new processor optimized for deep learning. our vision is that the next quantum leap in efficacy of deep learning will be unlocked by joint optimization of algorithms and the hardware on which they run. our solution is software programmable and promises to dramatically improve efficiency in comparison to the current state of the art. our technical team is highly experienced, with a long list of pioneering semiconductor and software products under its belt. we highly value transparency, integrity and team work. we strive for a culture that is informal, yet very professional.
aside from the rare opportunity to contribute to a brand-new processor architecture, we offer a rate of learning and career progress that is only achievable at early stage companies, as well as highly competitive compensation and benefits. this is your chance to become one of the first members of a fast-growing team working on cutting edge technology.
as a compiler engineer, you will work closely with a deep learning expert to define and implement an efficient and easy-to-use toolchain bridging deep learning frameworks and our processor hardware. you will be solving challenging optimization problems by researching and implementing state-of-the art algorithms. the result of your effort will dramatically contribute to the overall performance of the processor, and your experiments and results will guide hardware architecture improvements.
responsibilities:

design and implement a set of compiler tools to translate from ml-oriented domain-specific languages (tensorflow, caffe, theano) to proprietary binary format
implement scheduling and parallel processing algorithms for our parallel processor
measure performance and optimize for hardware efficiency
design, develop, document, and maintain in-house software tools

qualifications:

excellent proficiency in c++ and c
experience with parallel algorithms and distributed systems
work experience with compilers, graph manipulation algorithms, or ic/fpga cad software
solid understanding of computer architecture
work experience with machine learning frameworks

if you like solving hard problems and enjoy bringing complex systems to life, we would love to talk to you!

title: R&D: MACHINE LEARNING AND DATA ANALYTIC
Data Science (Team Lead)
text:
data science (team lead) - unata inc. - job board view our website view all jobs data science (team lead) toronto, ontario, canada full time data science manager/supervisor lead data scientist  who are we? unata is a group of talented individuals who are on a mission to shape the grocery shopping experience of the future. we are an award-winning, product-focused company that powers digital grocery experiences for our highly-respected grocery partners to better serve their hundreds of thousands of shoppers. we provide a white-label platform for large retail grocery chains that provides a complete and unified digital customer experience, interweaving ecommerce, ecircular, and digital loyalty. a key differentiator is that every single customer touchpoint is automatically 1-to-1 personalized through our proprietary personalization technology. unata is headquartered in toronto, on and empowers respected retailers including lowes foods, longo’s, lunds & byerly’s, and raley’s. what makes working at unata so great? working with dedicated people that want to make an impact. this ain’t no another-day-another-dollar gig. a working environment where your opinions are valued. a team that appreciates learning new technologies and implementing them when they make sense. attending various developer conferences like pycon where our team is regularly selected to present. competitive compensation and stock options. stocked-up fridge full of food and beer. totally-optional, totally-fun activities every month, coordinated by our very own manager of happiness, plus the regular ping pong battles or board games in the office every friday. what are we looking for? tldr; unata is looking for a technical leader of our data science team. you might be the right fit for us if you’re an accomplished, seasoned, battle-scarred data scientist with a history of enterprise software (ideally saas). data science at unata is the foundation of everything we do to personalize the experience of our end users. your team will become the pillar of a mature data culture within unata. you’ll need to be ready to hit the keyboard from day one, even as you hire new team members to expand our capabilities (i.e. prepare to roll up your sleeves!). you love co-owning a product and building a team, company, and customer base around it. you’re a passionate believer in culture and leadership.   what will you be doing? the data science team at unata owns the following areas of our product: recommendations, analytics, and search. as director, you will be directly involved and contribute to the design, software engineering, and testing of those systems. you’ll be responsible for the architecture and engineering of our data, and the development of predictive algorithms and machine learning that will drive recommendations, analysis and insights into how our platform is being used by our partners. moreover, you’ll be responsible for educating and inspiring your fellow team members on the importance of data in everything we do.   requirements, requirements, requirements degree in software engineering, computer science, etc. excellent object-oriented software design skills, and strong knowledge of python (+ for pandas, scikits learn, numpy). excellent understanding of machine learning foundations. solid grasp of computer science concepts: data structures, algorithms, and programming paradigms. we are very keen on implementing red-black trees here at unata. you understand and implement engineering best practices: automated testing, version control systems, documentation, continuous integration, duct tape redundancy, etc. you feel at home (cd ~) in a unix development environment. you can clearly communicate complex technical concepts. you have built and shipped real software. you know… flappy bird clones… all that jazz. you can demonstrate and talk about your willingness to learn new things. like that new reactive microservice framework everyone’s been deploying on docker lately. bonus points! experience with the following technologies (c-c-c-c-combo breaker!): distributed data-stores and frameworks like apache cassandra, apache kafka, elasticsearch, mapreduce. rdbms (+ for postgresql). cool personal projects on github or other places, participation in kaggle competitions. oh! and a willingness to be the greatest ping pong player in the world (or the office).   read more apply for position apply for this position required* apply with linkedin apply with indeed apply with indeed first name* last name* email address* title: Applied Research Scientist
text:
job application for applied research scientist at element ai





















          apply now
        
applied research scientist

        at element ai
      
(view all jobs)

        toronto
      


we are putting together a world-class research and development team to build a platform enabling next generation ai-first businesses. as a research engineer in machine learning you will enjoy a unique opportunity to use your creativity both to pursue fundamental research and to apply cutting-edge techniques within applied projects. you will face diversified challenges and you may end up working on time-series, images, videos, control problems, etc. while doing so you will have access to the best hardware and you will be assisted by a team of it experts and software developers, to ensure most of your time is spent on core r&d challenges.
our research agenda covers many subjects and, based on your interests and our needs, you could explore generative models, reinforcement learning, constraint programming, etc. you will collaborate closely both with software developers and with scientists. in particular, you'll get the opportunity to discuss weekly with world-class academics from our faculty fellowship program, such as aaron courville, joelle pineau, christopher pal and doina precup. these collaborations will often lead to publications in the most important journals and conferences.
you have experience in machine learning, either through graduate studies or industrial r&d projects. you're also a solid programmer and you're comfortable doing scientific programming as well as product development. you can understand and implement techniques exposed in academic papers in your field.
you want to join us because you are passionate about:

fundamental research in machine learning;
explaining the data audit and data quality control to partners and clients;
exploring the wide variety of contexts and situations in which ml can be applied;
working with huge datasets and finding unexpected signal in them;
using and discovering the best tools to build working prototypes of ai services;
coding high-quality production code and continuously learning the best practices to turn research into delightful products;
building strong collaborative relationship with scientists, software developers, and program directors;
staying up-to-date on the scientific literature in your field, and even contributing to it by publishing in famous journals and conferences.

we want you to join us because you have:

a getting-things-done mindset with a desire not only to push the boundary of fundamental knowledge, but to turn it into products people love;
a ph.d or m.sc. in machine learning or a quantitative field and at least 3 years of industrial r&d experience;
the seniority of the candidate will be established through the interview process;​
a more experienced candidate could evolve into a leadership position as we grow the team;
experience and mastery of scientific programming and libraries relevant to your field for example: theano, tensorflow​, numpy, r, etc.; 
experience with at least one of the following programming language, preferably for the development of production code: python, c++, scala, go, c#, f# , javascript, java, etc.; 
an open mind and a desire to learn the best language/technology to solve a given problem;
experience working in a diversified team;
a history of shipping high quality code using cutting-edge techniques.

what we offer for your valuable work:

highly dynamic, innovative, passionate, intrapreneurial team;
open and inclusive company culture;
worldwide competitive salary; 
participation in the company success through the employee stock option plan;
participation in company employee benefits program;
flexible hours (outside of core hours);
autonomous, self-managed agile teams.
we strongly believe in collocated team dynamic. we would be happy to work with you if you can join the team in our montreal office.

we are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description
looking for a new and exciting challenge?
never heard of mindgeek? mindgeek is a company specializing in the development and marketing of highly trafficked web properties; a leader in its activity. but that’s only what we do, not who we are. so who are we? the best way to describe us would be nothing less than awesome! an overstatement? we don’t think so. and neither will you if you come work with us!
as a data scientist you will be responsible for analyzing complex data patterns in order to find new solutions to specific technical or business challenges within the area of web publishing and marketing. we expect you to have a solid training in computer science, software development, modeling, statistics and mathematics or any related quantitative field. you also have good business knowledge and a strong sense of initiative and adventure. you will work closely with technical and business teams to find innovative approaches to the various data processing challenges that our organization faces.
you will work on various systems like content recommendation engines, ad bidding systems, credit card fraud detection solutions, anomalous web traffic detection, and much more. 
responsibilities:

review recent technological and research advances from the community and integrate them with existing architecture
architect, develop and implement systems to optimize revenue, views and engagement
meet, communicate and present findings to internal clients
find creative solutions to current issues and identify new opportunities
develop and implement solutions including applying algorithms, improving existing algorithms, and developing custom algorithms
provide expert advice and assistance to other teams in the company

requirements:

m.sc. in data mining, machine learning, statistics, mathematics or similar field - ph.d. an asset
strong knowledge and proficiency in data mining algorithms including decision trees, probability networks, clustering, regression and neural networks
research-oriented and strong passion for empirical research on hard problems
strong programming skills in r, java, python or similar high-level languages
ability to present results to non-expert people

preferred qualifications:

familiarity with database environments and functional knowledge of sql.
experience with samza, kafka, yarn and other distributed and big data solutions
experience with unix/linux environment
experience and ability to work with big data problems
data science side project or kaggle competitions an asset

 
mindgeek offers its employees a competitive compensation plan and various perks including...

annual bonus plans and benefits package
flex and summer hours
tuition, conferences and training reimbursement program
discounts for nearby businesses and a 500$ yearly gym/fitness allowance
access to onsite ping-pong, foosball and pool tables
access to onsite cafeteria including a daily free complete breakfast (bacon and eggs on friday)
… and much more!

    
don’t be shy, apply. but only if you’re up for the challenge of a lifetime!
we thank all applicants for their interest, however only candidates under consideration will be contacted. no telephone calls please. no agency calls or emails.

title: Data Scientist
text:
maple leaf sports & entertainment career opportunities
































data scientist


employment duration:
full time


department:
marketing & creative services


location:
air canada centre


job code:
3595


closing date:
11/10/17



description
company overview
maple leaf sports & entertainment partnership (mlse) is one of north america’s leading providers of unimaginable experiences. we are the parent company of the toronto maple leafs (nhl), toronto raptors (nba), toronto fc (mls), and toronto marlies (ahl). our talented group of professionals are accountable for delivering everything our teams need to win. at the end of the day, our mission is simple: bring the world to its feet.
position overview
mlse is looking for a highly motivated and energetic data scientist to join our data science practice.  the mlse fans engage with the organization through multiple channels and generates vast swaths of information. our data scientists will be responsible to create high quality datasets and develop data science tools to drive fan experiences and services.
our data scientist will need extensive data modelling and data warehouse experience:

machine learning on large datasets
data preparation and transformation using hive, pig and spark
data warehousing concepts including facts, dimensions, star schemas
implementing etl process in data pipeline
design and deploy of systems to enable folks to consume and understand data faster
architect, build and launch new data models using python 3.0 or scala that provide intuitive insights to our stakeholders

responsibilities

work with large datasets to solve difficult non-routine analysis problems that enables mlse to elevate fan experience
conduct end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables and presentation
build and prototype analysis pipelines iteratively to provide insights at scale
analytical model development, design, and operational deployment
interact cross-functionally with a wide variety of people and teams. work closely with the mobile product team and brand teams to identify opportunities for, design, and assess improvements to mobile products/content
build recommendation systems to create best and next-best product offerings

requirements

expert level of data science development (spark, python, scala, julia), database languages (sql, hive) and apis
demonstrated skills in selecting the right statistical/ml tools given a data analysis problem
proven ability to develop partnerships with technical peers and business unit leaders
educational background in a quantitative field
entrepreneurial spirit and smart creative personality
team first, positive, people-oriented, and energetic attitude

we thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
maple leaf sports & entertainment partnership will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in the job application process. if you have difficulty using our online application system and/or you need an accommodation due to a disability, please email accommodations@mlse.com.

job description


ibm global business services: join a leader. consult with us.ibm global business services helps top-tier clients solve their most complex business and technical issues. as a data engineer, you will deliver innovative business consulting, business process design, systems integration, and application design and management to leading sector organizations in 17 industries worldwide. with access to resources that only a global leader can provide, you will learn valuable skills, gain access to a vast and diverse network of talented professionals, and enjoy unparalleled career, training, and educational opportunities.visit http://www.ibm.com/ca/ for more informationibm, the world's largest it and consulting company, is looking for talented data engineers to work closely with data scientists to identify and develop methods to collect and integrate a wide variety of data to be used in predictive analytics, machine learning or other data science use case. they develop data pipelines and iterative models for data experimentation using a variety of tools such as kafka, hadoop and cassandra, storm and spark. experience in areas of optimizing management of and deriving insights from non-structured non-relational data, and provide business value from content through improved information management is key. experience in analyzing text, streams, documents, social media, big data, speech with emerging hadoop-based big data, nosql, natural language processing, search and text analytics technologies and techniques. apply big data technologies such as hadoop, spark or streams with nosql data management and related programming languages for analytics and experimentation with large, multi-structured data sets.responsibilities:analyze complex data sets to answer strategic and operational business questionsacquire and synthesize the data from different external sources into usable and consistent formatwork closely with customer’s business, engineering, and executive teams, using data to drive iterative analytical modelsdesign, develop, quality assurance (qa) and maintain application codeprovide thought-leadership and dependable execution on diverse projects
